Entries.default: "Fentre, a moment."
"Your errand boy lost his satchel. I'm returning it to him."
"What business is it of yours who I talk to?

"Degnos is an associate of mine. His success is important to me, as it impacts my own."

His shrug is insouciance personified, slight and carefree.
[Punch Talfor.]

"That is good to hear. So rare it is that I am glad of a stranger's interference."

Talfor renders you a slight bow and a crooked, almost jesting smile.
"I've read your letter."
"Ah, and what did you think? Perguono, regale me with your thoughts."
"I have no intention of interfering with your plans. I will return Degnos' satchel and be on my way."
"What reason do I have to trust you with my thoughts?"
[Ignore him and walk past.]
[Attack] "You will see justice for this!"

"Have you had the unique pleasure of meeting Avetta? Degnos would not be the first to abandon her crew."

He plays with the knife at his waist and smiles grimly.
"'Revenge' can take many meanings. What's yours?"
"I didn't expect such whining from pirates."

"Perhaps I have been overlong with the Príncipi, who value fair play in a way Vailians do not."

He twists his face into a sneer, idly thumbing the dagger at his belt.

"It is not revenge on Avetta I want, but her cargo."

He turns to his hand, casually regarding the many rings on his fingers.

"To make an enemy of me is to heave your own body overboard!"

He brandishes a blade, disgust twisting his features into a dark caricature of his usual grin.
[Attack] "Bold words for a coward. When Avetta defended her ship, you ran with your tail between your legs, yelping like a whipped dog!"
[Attack] "If you'd like to test your steel against mine, you're welcome to try!"
"Am I not already waylaid?"
"That won't be necessary."
"I'll be on my way. If you wish to follow, that's your business."

"Were I a more fragile man, I might have found offense in your vulgar accusation."

His smile is sharp, drawn in irony. It promises violence. He winks.
"A gracious offer! We accept." He nods to his fellows, who smile and murmur agreement.
"Ah, aimico, the streets of Neketaka, they are too dangerous to travel without an escort. I insist my associates and I see you safely to your destination."
Entries.female:
"Ah, aimica, the streets of Neketaka, they are too dangerous to travel without an escort."

He cuts a slight bow. "I insist my associates and I see you safely to your destination."

Entries.default: "Stand aside, or I will make you."
"I imagine Avetta will have some choice words about this."

"A shame, then, that you will not live to hear them."

Talfor draws his weapon, and his companions do the same.
"I won't be bested by you!"
Talfor grabs your arm as you pass. His grip is firm, and his smile wide. He will not be deterred.

"Agh! Bazzo!" Talfor reels back with a strangled cry, palm pressed to his eye.

He draws his weapon, and his companions do the same.

"Aha, you are too slow, aimico! My belnanna has a better arm!"

Talfor draws his weapon, and his companions do the same.
Entries.female:
"Aha, you are too slow, aimica! My belnanna has a better arm!"

Talfor draws his weapon, and his companions do the same.

Entries.default:
"Madiccho! A pity we could not reconcile our desires. Here I had hoped we might become great friends!"

Talfor draws his weapon, and his companions do the same.

"It pains me to impose, but I must ensure Degnos has everything he needs for his next voyage."

He smiles wide, the corners of his eyes crinkling with mirth.
"I've read your letter - your penmanship is terrible. I'm embarrassed for you."

"I am wounded!"

Blush colors his cheeks, and he chuckles, the back of his hand held against his mouth.

"I saw you speak to my dear aimico, Degnos, so I thought to myself, 'Why, Talfor, you must meet him, too!'"

Arrayed about him are a small group of kith, well-armed and armored.
Entries.female:
"I saw you speak to my dear aimico, Degnos, so I thought to myself, 'Why, Talfor, you must meet her, too!'"

Arrayed about him are a small group of kith, well-armed and armored.

Entries.default: "Would you like an escort to Queen's Berth, fentre? You never know what rough types may be about, and I would hate to see you waylaid."
Entries.female: "Would you like an escort to Queen's Berth, tella? You never know what rough types may be about, and I would hate to see you waylaid."

Entries.default: A tall, wiry man blocks your path. He wears a sly smile as one might wear their most comfortable trousers.
"Perguono, let us be off."
"But what did you think of its contents, cuè?"
"A little revenge would not be amiss, I think."
"We'll spare her - so long as she surrenders, of course. If she seeks a fight, who am I to refuse her?"
